ygData.subject: Langseax
ygData.msgSnippet: According to Everlore, here s how to check if you have enough faction: Note: An easy way to check your faction for this quest is to go to Renth and say I will
ygData.messageBody:
According to Everlore, here's how to check if you have enough faction:

Note: An easy way to check your faction for this quest is to go to Renth and
say "I will hunt the murderer." If he gives you more information about it,
you have high enough faction to complete the quest. A great way to raise
your faction is to give gnoll fangs to Lysbeth McNaff in sets of three. She
is at the Pit of Doom.

I believe that you need more than just amiable, but not so much that it's
warmly, so somewhere inbetween the two.


----- Original Message -----
From: <Sean.Clark@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, October 29, 1999 8:44 AM
Subject: [EQCheats] Jared: Why you have to be that way??

> Does anybody know what faction (amiable, warmly, etc) that you need with
the
> Halas merchants to perform the Langseax quests???
> I spent about 3 hours running around Black Burrow the last couple of days,
> killing anything that moved. It seems like one out of about 10 gnolls
drops
> a Gnoll Tooth (fang??). I've collected 38 of them...killed maybe 300 -
400
> gnolls. Tedious...VERY tedious.
> Anyway...I was going to try the Langseax quest next time I can get
together
> with my Druid friend (for tracking and SoW...heard this is useful for
> following the dog during the quest)...but I was hoping somebody could give
> me an idea of what faction will work so I'm not wasting (any more) time.
> Thanks!
> Sean
